trans-unit.source: Add Source, Destination, and Bridge Messaging Endpoints
trans-unit.target: Add Source, Destination, and Bridge Messaging Endpoints

trans-unit.source: In the <link xlink:href="99e23df6-8965-4282-90f4-849a94f04676" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">BizTalk Services</link> topic, we saw that one of the core requirements from <token>af_integration</token> is to bridge the message and transport protocol mismatch between two disparate systems.
trans-unit.target: In the <link xlink:href="99e23df6-8965-4282-90f4-849a94f04676" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">BizTalk Services</link> topic, we saw that one of the core requirements from <token>af_integration</token> is to bridge the message and transport protocol mismatch between two disparate systems.

trans-unit.source: In cloud parlance, we should think of each system on the cloud as an endpoint on <token>azure_1</token>.
trans-unit.target: In cloud parlance, we should think of each system on the cloud as an endpoint on <token>azure_1</token>.

trans-unit.source: Rich messaging endpoints enable message exchange between these disparate applications (which are either extensions of on-premises applications or representing an application running on the cloud).
trans-unit.target: Rich messaging endpoints enable message exchange between these disparate applications (which are either extensions of on-premises applications or representing an application running on the cloud).

trans-unit.source: However, given that the two systems are disparate and probably follow different messaging format and protocols, it becomes imperative that <token>azure_1</token> provides rich processing capabilities between the two endpoints.
trans-unit.target: However, given that the two systems are disparate and probably follow different messaging format and protocols, it becomes imperative that <token>azure_1</token> provides rich processing capabilities between the two endpoints.

trans-unit.source: The processing capabilities could include the following:
trans-unit.target: The processing capabilities could include the following:

trans-unit.source: The ability to connect systems following different transport protocols
trans-unit.target: The ability to connect systems following different transport protocols

trans-unit.source: The ability to validate the message originating from the source endpoint against a standard schema
trans-unit.target: The ability to validate the message originating from the source endpoint against a standard schema

trans-unit.source: The ability to transform the message as required by destination endpoints
trans-unit.target: The ability to transform the message as required by destination endpoints

trans-unit.source: The ability to enrich the message by adding properties to the message context.
trans-unit.target: The ability to enrich the message by adding properties to the message context.

trans-unit.source: The properties can then be used to route the message to a destination or an intermediary endpoint.
trans-unit.target: The properties can then be used to route the message to a destination or an intermediary endpoint.

trans-unit.source: All these capabilities are made available through <legacyItalic>rich messaging endpoints</legacyItalic> available as part of <token>af_integration</token>.
trans-unit.target: All these capabilities are made available through <legacyItalic>rich messaging endpoints</legacyItalic> available as part of <token>af_integration</token>.

trans-unit.source: The following diagram depicts how rich messaging endpoints bridge mismatches between systems and applications.
trans-unit.target: The following diagram depicts how rich messaging endpoints bridge mismatches between systems and applications.

trans-unit.source: To sum it up, <token>af_integration</token> offers four major components (connectivity, validation, enrichment, transformation) that can be stitched together to provide rich messaging endpoints.
trans-unit.target: To sum it up, <token>af_integration</token> offers four major components (connectivity, validation, enrichment, transformation) that can be stitched together to provide rich messaging endpoints.

trans-unit.source: <embeddedLabel>Connectors</embeddedLabel>: These bridge the gap between different transport protocols as well as different LOB applications that exist on the premise behind a firewall but expose their operational endpoints on the cloud.
trans-unit.target: <embeddedLabel>Connectors</embeddedLabel>: These bridge the gap between different transport protocols as well as different LOB applications that exist on the premise behind a firewall but expose their operational endpoints on the cloud.

trans-unit.source: Bridges accept incoming messages from different protocols such as HTTP, FTP, and SFTP.
trans-unit.target: Bridges accept incoming messages from different protocols such as HTTP, FTP, and SFTP.

trans-unit.source: Bridges can send outgoing messages to different protocols such as HTTP, FTP, SFTP as well as other endpoints such as Azure Blobs, <token>sb2</token> Queues, Topics, and Relays.
trans-unit.target: Bridges can send outgoing messages to different protocols such as HTTP, FTP, SFTP as well as other endpoints such as Azure Blobs, <token>sb2</token> Queues, Topics, and Relays.

trans-unit.source: In addition, <token>af_integration</token> also provides connectivity to on-premise LOB applications such as SQL Server, SAP, Siebel, and Oracle databases/E-Business Suite.
trans-unit.target: In addition, <token>af_integration</token> also provides connectivity to on-premise LOB applications such as SQL Server, SAP, Siebel, and Oracle databases/E-Business Suite.

trans-unit.source: For more information, see <link xlink:href="c4263b70-bd4d-42b1-9d0b-619afdfaf8cd" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Service Bus Connect</link>.
trans-unit.target: For more information, see <link xlink:href="c4263b70-bd4d-42b1-9d0b-619afdfaf8cd" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Service Bus Connect</link>.

trans-unit.source: While setting up connectivity, you can also set rules based on which the message is transferred to different endpoints.
trans-unit.target: While setting up connectivity, you can also set rules based on which the message is transferred to different endpoints.

trans-unit.source: For more information, see <link xlink:href="498de1a4-3427-4314-a152-8d5a7f026cc0" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Routing Messages from Bridges to Destinations in the BizTalk Service Project</link>.
trans-unit.target: For more information, see <link xlink:href="498de1a4-3427-4314-a152-8d5a7f026cc0" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Routing Messages from Bridges to Destinations in the BizTalk Service Project</link>.

trans-unit.source: <embeddedLabel>Validation, Enrichment, and Transformation</embeddedLabel>: <token>af_integration</token> provides these capabilities as different stages of a ‘bridge’.
trans-unit.target: <embeddedLabel>Validation, Enrichment, and Transformation</embeddedLabel>: <token>af_integration</token> provides these capabilities as different stages of a ‘bridge’.

trans-unit.source: For more information, see <link xlink:href="1aef098a-aec9-4258-adb0-ad5abfa5b820" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Message Processing Bridges</link>.
trans-unit.target: For more information, see <link xlink:href="1aef098a-aec9-4258-adb0-ad5abfa5b820" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Message Processing Bridges</link>.
